skill.name: git
skill.description: Basic git operations for repository inspection. Use for git diff, git log, git status, git remote, and other read-only git commands.
skill.summary: Read-only git operations for viewing repository state, changes, and history.
skill.author: ETeissonniere

security_audit.summary: All 33 static findings are false positives. The scanner misidentified markdown code blocks (git command examples) as shell execution and git terminology (diff, log) as cryptographic algorithms. This skill only performs read-only git operations with hardcoded arguments.

content.value_statement: This skill provides read-only git commands for inspecting repository state. It allows viewing changes, history, and branch information without modifying any data.
actual_capabilities: View repository status and current branch
Show unstaged and staged changes with git diff
Display commit history with configurable output
Inspect file history and blame information
List remote URLs to detect platform type
limitations: Read-only operations only, no commit or push capability
Limited to git commands listed in the skill documentation
Does not handle complex git operations like rebase or merge

use_cases.title: Review Code Changes
use_cases.description: View all uncommitted changes before creating a commit. Shows diffs with statistics for quick review.

use_cases.title: Debug Production Issues
use_cases.description: Examine commit history and file changes to trace when a bug was introduced.

use_cases.title: Understand Codebase Structure
use_cases.description: List tracked files and view file history to understand how code is organized.

prompt_templates.title: Show Uncommitted Changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the git skill to show me all unstaged changes in the current repository.

prompt_templates.title: View Recent Commit History
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the git skill to display the last 10 commits with one-line summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Compare Branch Changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the git skill to show what commits are on the current branch but not on main.

prompt_templates.title: Check File History
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the git skill to show the commit history for a specific file.

output_examples.output:
Modified files:
src/utils.js | 12 lines
tests/test.js | 3 lines

Summary: +45 lines, -12 lines

abc1234 Fix authentication bug
def5678 Add user profile page
ghi9012 Update dependencies
jkl3456 Refactor database layer

Current branch: feature/authentication
Main branch: main
Remote: git@github.com:user/repo.git

best_practices: Use --oneline and -n flags to limit output to essential information
Run git status first to understand the repository state before detailed inspection
Use git diff --stat for a quick summary before viewing full diffs
anti_patterns: Avoid using this skill for write operations like commit, push, or merge
Do not rely on this skill for complex git operations requiring user interaction
Avoid running git commands without understanding the current branch context

faq.question: Can this skill make changes to my repository?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides read-only git operations. It cannot commit, push, merge, or modify any repository data.

faq.question: What git commands are supported?
faq.answer: This skill supports git status, diff, log, branch, remote, show, blame, and ls-files. See SKILL.md for the complete command reference.

faq.question: How do I see changes in a specific file?
faq.answer: Use git diff to see unstaged changes or git diff HEAD to see all changes including staged ones.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with GitLab repositories?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill can detect remote URLs to determine if the repository is on GitHub or GitLab.

faq.question: How do I limit the commit history output?
faq.answer: Use the -n flag with git log to limit the number of commits shown. For example, git log --oneline -n 10.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use in production?
faq.answer: Yes. Since all operations are read-only, there is no risk of accidentally modifying repository state.
